info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 9:46PM EST until January 17 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation of snow, sleet and some freezing rain expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southern Litchfield County in northwestern Connecticut and the Capital District, Washington County, the Taconics, and Mid Hudson Valley in eastern New York. * WHEN...Until noon EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches or isolated trees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will overspread the region from south to north tonight. The snow will turn to mixed precipitation from south to north after midnight through early Monday morning. Snowfall rates of around an inch a hour are possible late tonight into early Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
